election_record.label: Vermont 1807 Governor

overview.note: The Official Results list Israel Smith with 9903 votes and Isaac Tichenor with 8571 votes but the county totals add up to 9870 votes for Smith and 8540 votes for Tichenor.

"The following statement of Votes for Governor, will give the best display of information collected on that interesting subject...Tichenor...6881...Smith...8622. [The results are incomplete as of this edition for both candidates, many towns' results were not included, there being "no returns" from some towns in all counties except for Bennington County.]...Which gives a majority for Mr. Smith of 1741 votes...So we present our readers with 2670 more votes than were counted the last year--It must be however, observed that the returns of the last year do not inlude the lost votes which amounted to about 960--A calculation has been made of the probable issue of the votes from the towns not yet heard from--and allowing the votes in these towns to be more favorable to Mr. Tichenor than the last year, those votes cannot alter materially the present majority for Mr. Smith, so that we think we may with confidence congratulate our republican fellow-sitizens with the happy propect--that the reproach will be taken away from our land, and that a body which is truly Democratic will be adorned with a truly republican head." North Star (Danville, VT). September 19, 1807.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 19 and 26, list 908 votes for Israel Smith and 769 votes for Isaac Tichenor, with results received to that point, from 18 towns in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: The Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 9, lists 30 votes for Israel Smith in Hancock.

sub_unit.name: Leicester
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 14 and 28, the Green Mountain Palladium, September 14, the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 5, and The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 28, list 33 votes for Israel Smith and 62 for Isaac Tichenor in Leicester.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: No returns.

sub_unit.name: Middlebury
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 14, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 9, list 130 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Middlebury.

sub_unit.name: Monkton
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 14 and 28, the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 9, and the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 14, list 18 votes for Israel Smith in Monkton.

sub_unit.name: New Haven
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 14 and 28, lists 47 votes for Israel Smith and 45 for Isaac Tichenor in New Haven.
The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 14, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 9, list 63 votes for Israel Smith in New Haven.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 28, and The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 7, list 4 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Warren.

sub_unit.name: Weybridge
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 28, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 9, list 42 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Weybridge.

sub_unit.name: Whiting
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 7, 14 and 28, and The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 28, list 80 votes for Israel Smith in Whiting.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: Official Results list Israel Smith with 1110 votes and Isaac Tichenor with 816 votes but the town totals add up to 1067 for Smith and 776 for Tichenor.
The North Star (Danville, VT), September 19, reports 1104 votes for Israel Smith and 812 for Isaac Tichenor in Bennington.

The Epitome of the World, September 21 and 28, lists 1127 votes for Israel Smith and 815 for Isaac Tichenor in Bennington County. The Epitome of the World, September 7, lists 1124 votes for Israel Smith and 815 for Isaac Tichenor in Bennington County.

Spooner's Vermont Journal (Windsor, VT), October 19, The World, October 26, the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 28, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), October 27, list 876 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Bennington County.
The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 12, 19, and 26, report 1124 votes for Israel Smith and 815 for Isaac Tichenor in Bennington County.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountai Palladium, September 14, reports 196 votes for Israel Smith in Bennington.

sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 7, reports 100 votes for Israel Smith and 45 for Isaac Tichenor.
The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 14, reports 62 votes for Israel Smith in Dorset.

sub_unit.name: Alburgh
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the World, September 28, lists 98 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Alburgh, in the "SUMMARY" section, where county totals are listed. Grand Isle County is not listed and Alburgh is the only town with individual results listed in this section.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Isaac Tichenor with 711 votes but the town totals, even with no results from Barton and Topsham add up to 720 votes.

The Green Mountain Palladium, September 7, lists 106 votes for Israel Smith and 76 for Isaac Tichenor in Rockingham.

sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 14, the Green Mountain Palladium, September 14, and the Epitome of the World, September 14, report 15 votes for Israel Smith and 30 for Isaac Tichenor in Vernon.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: Official Results list Israel Smith with 1596 votes but the town totals add up to 1606.

sub_unit.name: Andover
sub_unit.note: Several Sources, including the Epitome of the World, September 14, and the Green Mountain Palladium, September 7, list these returns from Andover and Weston together as one set of results for both towns.
The Epitome of the World, September 14 and 21, list 8 votes for Isaac Tichenor in "Andover and Weston".

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.note: The Bethel Town Records report 31 votes for Issac Tichenor in Bethel.

The Green Mountain Palladium, September 14, lists 28 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Bridgewater.

The Green Mountain Palladium, September 7, lists 50 votes for Israel Smith in Plymouth.

sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 7, and the Epitome of the World, September 21, list 89 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Royalton.

sub_unit.name: Stockbridge
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 7, and the Epitome of the World, September 21, list 50 votes for Israel Smith in Stockbridge.
The Stockbridge Town Records do not report any votes other than those listed for the top 2 candidates in Stockbridge.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 7, reports 155 votes for Israel Smith and 50 for Isaac Tichenor in Windsor.
